course.title: War Stories
course.description: This course looks at artistic representations of modern warfare and asks what effects war has on those who survive it. How should we represent the horrors of war, and how should we remember them? By reading books by O'Brien and Hemingway, and watching films by Coppola and Bigelow, we'll debate whether the experience of war can ever be adequately communicated to those who weren't there, and whether these attempts can prevent future generations from repeating the mistakes of the past.
